title: PXE Install - winnt.exe out of memory?

forumNotes.author: hxckid
forumNotes.content:
Hi guys,  

I'm attempting to use Barts Network Disk to PXE my dying Vaio back to life (No CD/USB etc)  

Its a PCG-GRT815e, 512mb RAM P4 2.8.  

Everything was running smooth, so far I have managed to boot into the network environment, access the share, and use fdisk to erase all partitions. I created a new partition and did a full format. All good, I have a C: drive now.  

The tut I am following ([http://www.lockstock...xe-boot-windows](http://www.lockstockmods.net/2008/05/26/easy-way-to-pxe-boot-windows "External link")) says to run SMARTDRV which I've done, then navigate to and execute winnt.  

As soon as I confirm that the path to i386 is correct, the installer tells me we're out of memory and can't continue.  

I have tried running Barts disk with all of the options (EMM386 on or off) but no use. Anyone have any advice? I've looked around quite a bit but can't seem to see anything.   

Thanks a bunch guys

forumNotes.author: Sha0
forumNotes.content: What is in your CONFIG.SYS? Are any memory managers in there?
